meanings.definition: To discolor or damage with a mark or spot.
meanings.sent1: The spilled juice was staining the white tablecloth.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally got mud on her shoes, staining them.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was staining the carpet with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: His careless words were staining their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The ink staining the paper created a permanent mark.

meanings.definition: The act of applying a colored substance to something to change its appearance.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed the art of staining wood to give it a rustic look.
meanings.sent2: The painter used a brush for staining the canvas with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The children had fun staining their hands with colorful paints.
meanings.sent4: The chef's secret was staining the dish with a unique sauce.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight filtering through the stained glass was staining the floor with beautiful hues.
